content.question: Students create a circuit with a variable power supply and a single variable resistor. For several trials, the students vary the value for both the voltage <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the power supply and the resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the variable resistor and then measure the resulting current. The data for the current as a function of <math alttext="1 over R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are plotted in the graph above. Assuming the scale on both of the axes is linear, for which two data points was the value of the voltage the same?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
